text.p: Altera Corp and Synopsys Inc said Wednesday they formed a strategic five-year agreement to jointly develop and market next-generation high-level design tools and methodologies for complex programmable logic devices.
The companies described the devices as the fastest growing segment of the semiconductor market.

This comprehensive strategic alliance unites Synopsys' high-level design technology and Altera's CPLD physical implementation environment to streamline the design process for the industry's most advanced CPLDs with device densities ranging from 10,000 to 100,000-plus gates. Products resulting from the alliance are expected in the first half of 1997 for both Windows and UNIX platforms.

Under the agreement, the companies will work together on joint R&D, marketing and customer support programs. In the near-term, Altera will provide unique proprietary technology to Synopsys for co-development of high-level design solutions optimized for Altera CPLDs.

In addition, both companies will enhance existing products to provide tightly integrated joint solutions to mutual customers. Longer-term, the alliance will result in new high-level design products-including behavioral design tools and methodologies for CPLDs from Synopsys -- and advanced CPLD physical implementation products from Altera.
